column4: does anyone know why java's not in the repositories (sun-j2re1.5)?
it's in hoary-extras, but the mirror ahd an inaccurate Packages.gz a few hours ago
thanks, so in other words just wait for a while until it comes back?
do you have hoary-extras ? If so yes
the other way is to download the deb directly with wget
but won't that possibly give issues in the future with upgrades and the like?
I meant d/l it from the repo itself
same deb..
thanks for the advice. will wait a few hours and if it's still not there will try wget.
update-alternatives --config java
thanks, thats exactly what I needed. Except now java --version says "Could not create the Java virtual machine" :(
did you use a java deb or install from the sun installer?
was a while back, before I upgraded, but I see jre-1_5_0_01-linux-i586.bin in my downloads
if you installed with synaptic, remove with synaptic or apt
the removed package will still be in the cache so you can reinstall it after you get a working java
I still have a java version located at /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.4.2-gcj-4.0-1.4.2.0/ that wasn't installed with apt - how would I get rid of it? rm -rf?
no
run   update-alternatives --config java
- so then just leave the old version installed?
that installation is the "free" java installed by default
I did - I'm not sure if it would be needed or not
possibly it isn't, but I play safe ;)
thanks, java working great now! update-alternatives also good to know about.
glad to hear it :)
